alert.note: Alert for Schleicher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 08 at 7:37PM CDT until May 08 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble, Menard, Schleicher and Sutton. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Mckavett, Yates Crossing, London, Cleo, Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Toe Nail crossing San Saba River, RM 2291 crossings along Bear Creek, County Road 351 crossing Big Saline Creek, County Road 370 crossing Big Saline Creek, KC 210 crossing West Bear Creek, Dunagan crossing San Saba River, Ranch Road 2291 crossing Las Moras Creek and County Road 370 crossing Big Saline Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
